tasks.title: Complete corpus balancing for MoE training - generate ~2,500 documents across 80+ domains
tasks.description:
## Context
Building a balanced corpus capable of training ~100 specialized micro-models for a Mixture of Experts (MoE) system.

## Current State (as of 2025-12-17)
- Total samples: 237 documents
- Domains covered: 84/100
- Balance score: 0.364 (target: >0.7)
- Gap: ~2,500 documents needed

## What Works
Parallel sub-agents can generate high-quality domain content:
- 5 agents ran in parallel, each generating 5 docs
- Produced authentic content with real terminology, citations, formulas
- Domains added: philosophy, civil_engineering, criminal_law, robotics, archaeology

## Key Files
- docs/corpus-balancing-plan.md - Full strategy document
- scripts/analyze_corpus_balance.py - Balance analyzer
- scripts/generate_sample_docs.py - Template generator (low quality, use agents instead)

## Next Steps
1. Run balance analyzer to identify critical gaps: `python scripts/analyze_corpus_balance.py`
2. Launch parallel agents for each gap domain (5 docs each)
3. Commit and push in batches
4. Re-index and re-run repo_showcase.py to verify improvement
5. Target: PageRank top 20 should show domain diversity, not just "assert, test, processor"

## Scaling Strategy
- 20 parallel agents × 5 docs = 100 docs per batch
- ~25 batches to reach 2,500 docs
- Priority domains (0 docs): chemical_engineering, biomedical_engineering, computer_vision, 
  operations_management, religious_studies, art_history, photography, woodworking, team_sports, etc.

## Success Criteria
- Balance score > 0.7
- 80+ domains with 25+ docs each
- PageRank top 20 shows domain terms, not code artifacts
- Concept clusters align with knowledge domains
